intro: Randia korthalsii, commonly known as the Korthals's randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Randia korthalsii typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
